summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from January 27, 2020, discussing a press conference held by the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) in front of Jeffrey Epstein's brownstone. FBI personnel express frustration that victims were not given advance notice, leading to anger and feelings of betrayal among victims and their advocates.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned in a forwarded news article headline regarding the FBI seeking an interview about Jeffrey Epstein and his lack of cooperation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case; the press conference was held in front of his brownstone, and the investigation involves him.

connections.description: The forwarded news article indicates the FBI is seeking to interview Prince Andrew about Jeffrey Epstein, suggesting an investigatory link.

events.title: USAO Press Conference at Epstein's Brownstone
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office held a press briefing in front of Jeffrey Epstein's brownstone. FBI victim specialists and victims were not given advance notice, causing significant anger and feelings of betrayal.

locations: Epstein's brownstone (presumably in New York, based on context)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office held a press conference regarding Jeffrey Epstein in front of his brownstone on or before January 27, 2020.
FBI victim specialists and victims were not given advance notice of the press conference, leading to feelings of anger and betrayal.
An FBI employee forwarded a news article stating U.S. authorities claimed Prince Andrew was providing 'zero cooperation' as the FBI sought an interview about Epstein.
The email chain reveals internal FBI communication and concern over victim notification protocols in high-profile cases.
